snippet: Will scrutiny lead to greater scrutiny at banks that now seem too big to manage?
abstract: Editorial contends various investigations into JPMorgan Chase's dealings raise obvious questions of whether banks have become not only too big to fail but too big to manage; holds for the investigations of JPMorgan and other banks to make a real difference, federal authorities will have to show a willingness that has thus far been lacking to get tougher with banks and bankers.
lead_paragraph: Will scrutiny lead to greater scrutiny at banks that now seem too big to manage?
